polished_script:
HOOK: December will prove if you're actually committed to your goals. [ON-SCREEN: December = The Truth Test]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: You know that agent who crushed it in October, talked big about Q4 goals, then mysteriously goes quiet after Thanksgiving? [ON-SCREEN: Where do agents go in December?] Maybe you're already mentally checking out, thinking "I'll restart January first." You're telling yourself the market's dead anyway, right? [ON-SCREEN: "The market's dead anyway..."]

[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But mindset coach Paul Salter says December separates the committed from the just interested.

INSIGHT: Here's what Paul told me on the show. Most agents think they're committed, but they're actually just interested. [ON-SCREEN: Committed vs. Interested] Interested agents negotiate with circumstances: "I'll work hard... unless it's cold, unless it's the holidays, unless my kids are off school." [ON-SCREEN: "Unless... unless... unless..."] But committed agents? Paul says it perfectly: "If you're committed to your goal, the holidays, the weather, other people's actions leave you absolutely unfazed." [ON-SCREEN: "Committed people don't negotiate with circumstances"] They don't need perfect conditions. They just show up. Even December 23rd.

REFRAME: While everyone else is at holiday parties, committed agents are building January's pipeline. [ON-SCREEN: Building January's Pipeline] You can start today. This is your competitive advantage sitting right in front of you.

CTA: "Are you committed or just interested? Tell me in the comments."

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: December separates committed agents from interested ones. Which are you? ðŸŽ¯ Full episode with Paul Salter in bio.

HASHTAGS: #RealEstate #RealtorTips #Mindset #December #Commitment

SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "Committed people don't negotiate with circumstances."

PERFORMANCE_NOTES: 
1. Emphasize "December will PROVE" with strong eye contact on "prove"
2. Slow down on Paul's quote - let it land with gravitas  
3. Build energy through REFRAME - this should feel like a rallying cry

_metadata.rewrite_changelog: Replaced vague 'pick one income-producing activity' CTA with hyper-specific action: call 5 past clients before 10am tomorrow. Added concrete details throughout (December 23rd, blocking off dates, 6 months). Kept strongest line verbatim and built around it.
_metadata.judge_note: Name the activityâ€”'call three expireds,' 'door-knock your farm,' 'text ten past clients'â€”generic IPAs don't move needles.
